Drugs. 
     634. There is a disposition with many parents to dose children perpetually with medicine. They always have a supply on hand, and when any slight indisposition is manifested, caused by overeating or exhaustion, the medicine is poured down their throats, and if that does not satisfy them, they send for the doctor. . . . The child is drugged to death, and the parents console themselves that they 
                                                                           150
have done all they could for their children, and wonder why they must die when they did so much to save them. . . . Upon the gravestones of such children should be written, "Died of Drug Medication." --H. R.
